newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Cathay increases HK/KL frequency.
newsitem.headline: Cathay increases HK/KL frequency.

text.p: Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd has added two flights from Hong Kong to Kuala Lumpur bringing the total number of services to the Malaysian capital to nine per week, an airline statement says.
The two new morning flights leave Hong Kong on Tuesday and Thursdays at 1010 local, arriving in Kuala Lumpur at 1405 local, the statement adds.

"The increase in capacity is in response to customer demand for more frequencies. In addition, the timing of the new return flight, which leaves Kuala Lumpur at 1605 local and arrives at 1955 local, offers Cathay passengers excellent connections to our European and Los Angeles flights," said Cathay's south east Asian route manager William Ling in a statement.
